abstract: There is a big temptation for companies to cut their R.& D. spending, especially during bear markets. But such thinking is shortsighted, a study says.
snippet: There is a big temptation for companies to cut their R.& D. spending, especially during bear markets. But such thinking is shortsighted, a study says.
lead_paragraph: ESPECIALLY when times are tough, beware of companies that cut their spending on research and development. The stock market tends to punish such businesses and reward those with a commitment to R.& D.  often years before long-term projects reap benefits.

headline.main: To Make a Stock Pop, Innovate
headline.print_headline: To Make A Stock Pop, Innovate
